post_text:
Data Confirmation

Parents please complete your data confirmation in your Aeries Parent Portal. This allows you to print and sign the needed documents to turn in with your child's first distance learning drop off. You also update and change any emergency card information.
If you need to go back and re print the forms you will find them under the notifications options in your portal.

Please turn in the below

*Mandatory Signature Pages
*Technology Agreement
*Signed Emergency Card
*Compact

Optional
*Free and Reduced meals
*Pesticide

Thank you!
FDS Front Office

post_text:
Please help me get the word out about the FREE COVID-19 Supply Giveaway for Foresthill. Taking place on Saturday, 5/2 from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. at the Foresthill High School. These supplies have been made possible through a grant from the Placer Community Foundation working in collaboration with local agencies, churches, vendors and individuals.

These supplies are for EVERYONE! No need to belong to any club, church or the Chamber. Dried and canned food for meals, along with COVID-19 essentials and toiletries may be used now or stored for another time we need to shelter in place.

Hello FDS Families!

We miss seeing our students and would like to invite you to our special car parade at the school on Friday. So‚Ä¶hop in the car and be greeted, cheered, and waved by all of our wonderful teachers while driving through the FDS roundabout. Teachers, staff, and first responders will be a part of the parade! Please see the important information below.

What: FDS Car Parade
Date: Friday, April 24
Times: 10:00a TK-3/10:30a 4 ‚Äì 8 (Families with children in multiple grades may choose either time.)
Starting Point: FDS Roundabout
Important Message: Please drive slowly, safely, and stay in your car.

post_text:
April 15, 2020

Hello FDS Families, Staff, and Board:

Thank you to all of the families that we saw yesterday at FDS during pick up of Distance Learning materials. All of the teachers and staff in attendance were very excited to see many of our dearly missed students. Though it was a very successful pick up day with almost all families receiving their Distance Learning materials, we still have a small amount left. If you were not able to pick up your student‚Äôs materials yesterday, please pick up the required items tomorrow, Thursday, April 16 between 10:00 a.m. and noon. The materials are required as they will be collected on May 4 for grading purposes and ultimately for report cards.
Please look for more information and details regarding technology access, grading, return of student personal belongings, and other school closure/Distance Learning related matters in Friday‚Äôs Family Newsletter.

Thank you.
Jack
Superintendent/Principal

post_text:
Dear FDS Families:
We are asking for your patience and understanding as we navigate this new normal. Staff is diligently working to put together the appropriate program for all. In the meantime here are some suggestions to keep your student(s) in the educational mindset.
Keep routine as normal as possible
Read, Read, Read‚Äîat least 20 minutes each day
Practice math facts (Mental math) or flash cards if you have them, play board games (monopoly, dice, multiplication war, matching games)
Write‚ÄîHave students write creative stories, journal, make comic book stories, write about a book they have read
Draw, color, create
Be active at least 30 minutes daily‚Äî

Foresthill Divide School
October 22, 2019 at 11:11 AM ¬∑

FDS Friends and Families!
The 6th grade classes are selling Butter Braid Pastries as a fundraiser to earn money for science camp. Would you like to order? They are $14 each. These are so easy and delicious and great to have for Thanksgiving and Christmas or just super easy to thaw over night and bake the next morning.

Please choose from the following flavors or one of each:
Strawberry and cream cheese
Bavarian creme
Raspberry
Cinnamon
Apple
Blueberry and cream cheese

To order, or if you have any questions please contact Amber Mudd at tuppermudd@gmail.com or call/text 530-320-9214. All orders and payment must be in by 10/31/19 and the pastries will be delivered 11/21/19 at 1:00 p.m. to the school.

post_text:
October 22, 2019

Hello FDS Families, Staff, and Board.
Based on the information available yesterday, we have begun initial preparations for keeping our school open during the anticipated Public Safety Power Shutoff (PSPS) on Thursday and Friday. Please note that I have not yet received notification regarding an official shutdown. We are simply preparing for that possibility.
Likewise, please consider preparing on your end should the power shutoff actually occur.
At this time, we will keep school open on Thursday and Friday regardless of the PSPS status barring safety or any other extenuating circumstances unknown to us at this time.
I will keep everyone timely apprised on this PSPS matter.
Thank you.
Jack
Superintendent/Principal

PG&E information available at: https://m.pge.com/#outages

October 22, 2019

At this time, we will keep school open on Thursday and Friday regardless of the PSPS status barring safety or any other extenuating circumstances unknown to us at this time.

Dear Families:
Due to the pending power outage a robo-call and email have gone out to families to let you know the decision was made to close school Wednesday-Friday.
If the power is restored earlier school will resume. Mr. Kraemer will notify families once power is restored. We anticipate resuming school on Monday.
Please note Kids Club will be closed and all sporting events and on campus meetings or services will not occur during this outage.

Happy Wednesday FDS Families:
Cross Country practice has started! If you are interested in participating, it's not too late, come on out and join the team.
Currently the team is practicing at FDS on Mondays, Wednesdays and Thursdays 2:45pm. Practices may move to the high school but not yet! Stay tuned for updates.
Students will need a permission slip to participate. Please see the front office to obtain that slip.
Come on out and support the Mountain Lions!!

Just a reminder...on minimum days all students, including siblings of students practicing for a sport are to go home.

We do not have supervision on campus after 12:45. There is NO tutoring or homework support as teachers have conferences.

Kids Club is available (you must be signed up first) if you need child care.

We appreciate your help and support.

post_text:
FDS Gives a HUGE thank you to the Foresthill Lions' Club for supporting our Read Across America event.
Students read books for the month of February. For each book read they received a raffle ticket. All tickets were placed in a grade level jar.
The Lions' Cub donated one Amazon Kindle per grade level and our SDC class.
We had an assmebly today and drew the winning tickets! 10 students are now the proud owners of a brand new Amazon Kindle!
Keep Reading FDS Kiddos!

Daddy/Daughter Dance Pictures are in!

If your student attends FDS, the pictures will be given to their teacher. They will be sending them home with the students.

If you attend another school, pictures will be up in the office (at FDS) for your pick-up.

Please let me know if you are interested in re-orders. We can print in any size you would like. You may send me an email at keverett@fusd.org

Thank you again for supporting our fundraiser,
Mrs. Everett

We wanted to let you know we will start school tomorrow at our regular start time of 8:05. Also Kids' Club will be open tomorrow regular hours. We will dismiss at our normal time of 2:30.
A huge thank you to our M&O team for their hard work clearing walkways and ensuring safety for students, families and staff. You gentlemen ROCK!

We appreciate everyone's flexibility and community spirit today as we traversed our late start. Thank you!

post_text:
Dear Families:
We are excited to announce that FDS will once again offer testing for the Academic Talent Search sponsored by Sacramento State University.
4th-8th grade students have the opportunity to participate in the test here at school. Results will be mailed to families and the school. Students then qualify to take classes this summer at Sac State!
Choose from over 100 classes such as creative computing, messy science, law, neuroscience, Lego Robotics and many others.
Be on the look out for flyers regarding this exciting opportunity.

More information to follow. Test date will be February 18th!

www.csus.edu/coe/ats

post_text:
Dear FDS Families:
We have lots of activities coming up!

1. 10/25 Spirit Rally--1:30pm

2. 10/26 Harvest Festival (costumes are allowed) 5-8pm in the gym.

3. 10/31 Halloween Parade 8:30am
(students may wear Halloween costumes that are school appropriate, no face make up of ANY kind, no weapons, no blood and gore, must be able to participate in PE and all other classes throughout the day). Parents may attend

4. 11/1--No School (professional development day for staff)

5. 11/6 Board Meeting 6:30pm FES

We will send a robo-call Friday evening to remind everyone of the No School day on 11/1!

Happy Wednesday :)

post_text:
Dear Families:
We were contacted by the Forest Service today. They let us know several families are parking in their lot to pick up students at the end of the day.
This is not a parking lot for FDS. Please do not park there. They have posted signs stating parking for customers only.
Please be aware, spread the word, and park in our school parking lot as needed.
Thank you for your support.

post_text:
Happy Monday Families!

We have lots of fun events going on this week.

9/24--Fundraiser assembly--students are bringing home packets for the fundraiser today

9/26--Fire Prevention Games--Don't be alarmed if you see the fire trucks on campus. They are here for fun and games with the students

9/28--Hawaiian Spirit Day (wear your favorite Hawaiian clothing--Please follow school dress code---NO FLIP FLOPS)
-Luau from 2-4pm for 6th-8th grade.

10/3 Picture Day

Don't forget next week is Conference Week. We will dismiss daily at 12:45.

We hope your three day weekend was amazing. Here are a few upcoming dates to note.

Have a great week.

post_text:
ATTN: Parents of Bus Riders!
Thank you for returning your bus applications and payments timely!

Bus passes for students, with complete information and payments turned in, were sent home today! Please make sure your student has their pass attached or kept in their backpack. If your student did not receive a pass today, please call Debby at the District Office for information and assistance (367-2966, Ext.100).

If you just recently turned in your bus application/payment, passes will be produced and handed out to students next week. To ensure that there is no interruption to your child's transportation, please make sure applications/payments are turned in as soon as possible.

Thank you!

post_text:
Happy Tuesday FDS Families! Welcome back to school.

Please remember to go to our school website and read over all of the opening day paperwork, sign, and return the papers that came home with students yesterday. Please keep your packet clipped together for easy return. www.fusd.org

As a reminder we dismiss Monday-Thursday at 2:30pm and 2:00pm on Fridays.

post_text:
Happy Tuesday Families! We are back in the office 7:30-4:00pm and getting ready for the beginning of a new school year.
7th grade families--Please get your Tdap immunizations! Once you have the paperwork you can email, fax, or walk them in! We would love to have them before school starts.
7th grade students may NOT start school without this immunization.

There are two free immunization clinics:

Roseville 8/8 (TOMORROW) 3-6pm
800 All America City Blvd, Roseville, CA
Auburn 8/16 3-6pm
8/16 in Auburn Community Development Agency room 3091, County Center Drive, Auburn, CA

See you soon!
